News and developments from Justia and the tech world -----
June 2020 Edition

Reminders

Backups. Remember to back up your laptop regularly. If your external hard drive is not working, please report it immediately to your supervisor and IT department.

Video Conference. Join meetings on time. If possible, join the meeting earlier than two minutes before start time. Do not forget to turn the camera on.

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

July 4th - USA Independence day

Independence Day, one of America’s biggest holidays, commemorates the Declaration of Independence of the United States on July 4, 1776. It is often known as “the Fourth of July.”

TEAM ACTIVITIES

Justia's First Virtual Cook Off

The first virtual cook-off competition at Justia was a great success. Special thanks to all participants for sharing their cooking talents and tasty-looking photographs! We couldn't have done it without you. With over 20 delicious dishes entered into the competition, the battle for being named the best chef and winning the $50 Amazon gift card was fierce. Congratulations to the winner, Miguel Berlanga!

Get To Know Our Teammates

Knowing your teammates as people rather than just job roles fosters and builds team spirit, confidence, and trust. Read these little-known facts about our teammates and guess which person they belong to.
  • This person performed music around the world.
  • As a child, this person played soccer and won a regional championship in their first year.
  • This person likes to perform magic tricks at parties.
  • This person knows how to play six different musical instruments.
  • As a child, this person earned a black belt in karate.
Edgar Cano
Clayton Dodds
Carlos Quintanilla
Katherine Le
Meztli Vergara

We will share the correct answers tomorrow on Slack!

BLAST FROM THE PAST

Justia: Back in the Day
& Moving Forward

After its foundation and first operations in an apartment, Justia has steadily evolved and overseen exceptional achievements since its official launch in 2003. It’s been all about goals and success. The best is yet to come.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Meditations by Marcus Aurelius

Available on Amazon

"I recommend it since it's a great book of the school of philosophy called "Stoicism," which teaches us to focus on the things we can control (like how we respond to things that happen to us) and to not worry about things we can't control (like money, social status, fame, and what others think), so we can live a better life, giving our best to the things we do without having to worry about the outcome."

- Emilio Delgado

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta & Jose Ramos
